abstract.text: Creates a virtual destination in a client.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The client that owns the virtual destination.
The name of the virtual destination.
The MIDI protocol variant to deliver to the destination. The system automatically converts messages to this protocol as needed.
On successful return, a pointer to the newly created destination.
A callback block the system invokes when a client sends MIDI data to the virtual destination.
Drivers don’t need to call this function. When they create devices and entities, the system automatically creates sources and destinations at that time. See
for information about the relationship between when a sender sends MIDI data to the destination and when it’s received.
The system calls the read block on a separate high-priority thread owned by Core MIDI.
After creating a virtual source, assign it the same unique ID it had the last time your app created it. Doing so permits other clients to retain persistent references to your virtual source.

abstract.text: Communicate with MIDI devices such as hardware keyboards and synthesizers.
An object that maintains per-client state.
Creates a virtual destination in a client.
Disposes of a virtual source or destination.
Returns contextual data assigned to an endpoint.
A MIDI source or destination an entity owns.
Sets contextual data on an endpoint.
Returns a destination in the system.
Returns the number of destinations in the system.
Returns the number of sources in the system.
Returns a source in the system.
A block receiving MIDI input that includes the incoming messages and a refCon to identify the source.
Creates a virtual source in a client.
The recommended number of microseconds in advance that clients should schedule output.
A reference to a CFString object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
